medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital secondary hypothyroidism due to isolated TSH deficiency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at various ages; one patient diagnosed at 25 days old presented with muscular hypotonia, temperature instability, and neonatal jaundice, while others were diagnosed later with short stature and mental retardation. The condition progressed variably, with some children experiencing significant delays in diagnosis and treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All affected children carry an identical homozygous splice site mutation in the TSH gene. Past medical history details are largely unremarkable, except for symptoms suggestive of hypothyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: Parents of affected children are first-degree cousins, indicating a potential genetic predisposition.
medical_history.social_history: The families live in remote regions of Turkey with limited access to medical care and previously had no routine TSH neonatal screening in place.
